items.title: Eliza Lucero is one of several leaders of the peaceful protest...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Eliza Lucero is one of several leaders of the peaceful protest movement which has demanded justice for Elijah McClain. For daring to challenge the impunity of the police she now could face as many as 31.5 years in prison.

Sign the petition to drop the political prosecution against Eliza and all the targeted protest leaders: http://www.denverdefense.org/petition

National Committee for Justice in Denver

Elijah McClain was murdered by Aurora police in August 2019. A mass peaceful protest movement demanded justice. Now the leaders of these peaceful protests face ...decades in prison for daring to challenge the impunity of the police.

Meet Eliza Lucero, one of the targeted activists.

Eliza, 23, grew up in a rural town in western Pennsylvania. She was encouraged to stand up against injustice from a young age. Her mom took her to her first protest at age 8, a march against mass incarceration.

Rampant poverty, racism, and anti-LGBTQ discrimination drove her deeper into activism. Eliza moved to Colorado in 2018 and quickly became involved in local community organizing, including for housing justice, women‚Äôs and LGBTQ rights, and immigrant rights; and against police brutality.

She has been part of the struggle for Elijah McClain since the early months following his death, helping to put on protests, speaking out at city council meetings, and bringing public awareness to his case.

Sign the petition to drop the charges against Eliza and all the targeted peaceful protest leaders: http://www.denverdefense.org/petition

See More

items.title: ‚ÄúWe need a militant mass struggle, that type of struggle that...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

‚ÄúWe need a militant mass struggle, that type of struggle that shakes this country to its core!‚Äù

Following Wednesday‚Äôs fascist storming of the Capitol building in DC which exposed the collusion between white supremacists and the Capitol police, PSL Boston member and public school teacher Nino speaks to a crowd at an emergency demonstration called by Boston Socialist Alternative outlining what it will take for us to address this fascist violence that Trump has emboldened.

‚ÄúThe only way we can have a chance for humanity is to have a working class, socialist revolution from the bottom up, that‚Äôs proleterian in character, that unites the Black, Latino, Indigenous, poor white workers, the 140 million people plus in this country who are poor or near poor and facing eviction!‚Äù

items.title: 2020 PSL presidential candidate Gloria la Riva made this short...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

2020 PSL presidential candidate Gloria la Riva made this short documentary two years ago featuring heroes from the Rebel Army and other forces that liberated Cuba in 1959.

Gloria asks one man, a member of the Rebel Army, "how do you feel today, 60 years later?"

He answers, "We triumphed, we won. Look at all these boys [motioning to boys watching the parade]. They have a future. Before, they had none. Shining shoes, picking up rocks... Now, they can be a doctor, an engineer. ...That is the satisfaction of us completing our mission."

https://www.youtube.com/watch‚Ä¶

items.title: BREAKING ‚Äî CO State Attorney General Phil Weiser has announced...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

BREAKING ‚Äî CO State Attorney General Phil Weiser has announced that the state will open a grand jury investigation into the killing of Elijah McClain.

This would not have happened without the determined struggle of thousands of people demanding justice in Elijah‚Äôs case.

That said, we MUST remain vigilant and be sober about the reality that grand juries are frequently wielded as a tool for elected officials to pass the buck‚Äîand in instances involving the police, that often m...eans shifting responsibility off of themselves for letting the killers off with a slap on the wrist.

We do not know at this point what AG Weiser‚Äôs motivations are and all possibilies are on the table.

The people can say unflinchingly what is required for justice to be served in Elijah‚Äôs case: murder charges for Nathan Woodyard, Randy Roedema, and Jason Rosenblatt. We demand nothing less. #JusticeforElijahMcClain

See More

items.title: SIGN THE PETITION: Step down, Mayor Mike Coffman. "Homeless...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

SIGN THE PETITION: Step down, Mayor Mike Coffman. "Homeless Mike" stunt shows unfitness for public service

Aurora, CO Mayor Mike Coffman disqualified himself as a public servant when he went "undercover" posing as a homeless veteran to launch a demonization campaign against his constituents facing homelessness amidst a deepening housing crisis and deadly pandemic.

His week-long personal experiment apparently led him to dismiss the entire body of serious research on the issue ...of homelessness. He shared his conclusions with CBS 4 Denver: "These encampments are not a product of the economy or COVID. They‚Äôre not a product of rental rates or housing. They are part of a drug culture." When asked if the problem was not about a lack of shelter, Coffman answered, "It really isn‚Äôt. It is a lifestyle choice and it is a very dangerous lifestyle choice.‚Äù

It was apparently lost on Coffman that in posing himself as a homeless veteran, he was leaning on the high rates of homelessness among veterans, a disgraceful reality in the United States where men and women are sent to fight and bleed in wars for profit, then return home to find themselves without adequate jobs, healthcare, mental health treatment, and housing. It is these circumstances‚Äînot personal choice‚Äîwhich explain why veterans make up 11% of homeless adults in the US.

Aurora, like every city and town in the country, is on the verge of a major deepening of the current housing crisis. When the federal moratorium on evictions expires, some 520,000 Coloradans‚Äîmore than 15% of the state population‚Äîmay face eviction. A great number of Mike Coffman's constituents are hovering on the brink of homelessness, and whether they are able to stay in their homes will largely depend on the actions of our government, not on their "choice" between the "lifestyle" of homelessness or security for themselves and their families.

In the face of a deepening housing crisis coinciding with a deadly pandemic, now more than ever we need our leadership to understand the hardships facing their constituents and to fight to alleviate them. Mike Coffman has already demonstrated his determination to do the opposite‚Äîto demonize those who are struggling in order to justify doing nothing in the face of their suffering.

As residents of the Aurora area, we call for Mike Coffman's immediate resignation from Aurora mayor.

https://www.change.org/p/aurora-mayor-mike-coffman-mayor-mi‚Ä¶

See MoreStep down, Mayor Mike Coffman. "Homeless Mike" stunt shows unfitness for public service

change.org

items.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
